snippet: Afzal Guru, a 43-year-old militant, had been convicted of conspiracy in an attack in which nine people were killed, including security officials and one journalist.
abstract: India hangs Muhammad Afzal, militant with group Jaish-e-Muhammad, more than a decade after Dec 13, 2001 suicide attack on India's Parliament; execution draws protests from human rights groups concerned about growing use of capital punishment in such cases.
lead_paragraph: Afzal Guru, a 43-year-old militant, had been convicted of conspiracy in an attack in which nine people were killed, including security officials and one journalist.

headline.seo: India Executes Man Convicted in 2001 Attack on Parliament
headline.main: Amid Protests, India Executes Man in ’01 Parliament Attack
headline.print_headline: Amid Protests, India Executes Man in ’01 Parliament Attack
